gurmukhi: ਤਜੇ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ ਦੀਯੋ ਛੋਰ ਗਰਬੰ ॥੧॥
transliteration: Taje Sastra Astran Deeyo Chhodh Gadaban||1||
translation: And all abandoned their weapons and also their prride.1.
All of them, having been entrapped in her noose of love, forsook their anger,

gurmukhi: ਲਗੇ ਨੈਨ ਬੈਨੰ ਧਯੋ ਪਾਨ ਪੀਣੰ ॥
transliteration: Lage Nain Bainan Dhayo Paan Peenan||
translation: And rushed towards her in order to relish the wantonness of her eyes and the sweetness of her words;

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੇ ਝੂਮਿ ਭੂਮੰ ਛੁਟੇ ਜਾਨ ਪ੍ਰਾਣੰ ॥
transliteration: Gire Jhoom(i) Bhooman Choute Jaan Praanan||
translation: All of them, while swinging, fell on the earth as though they were lifeless;

gurmukhi: ਸਭੈ ਚੇਤ ਹੀਣੰ ਲਗੇ ਜਾਣ ਬਾਣੰ ॥੨॥
transliteration: Sabhai Chet Heenan Lage Jaan Baanan||2||
translation: All become without consciousness as though they were hit by the arrows.2.

gurmukhi: ਲਖੇ ਚੇਤ ਹੀਣੰ ਭੲੇ ਸੂਰ ਸਰਬੰ ॥ ਛੁਟੇ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ ਸਭੈ ਅਰਬ ਖਰਬੰ ॥
transliteration: Lakhe Chet Heenan Bhae Soor Saraban|| Chhoute Sastra Astran Sabhai Arab Kharban||
translation: Seeing all of the without consciousness, the weapons and arms were discharged by the gods;

gurmukhi: ਭਯੋ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਜੋਗੰ ਲਗੇ ਨੈਨ ਅੈਸੇ ॥
transliteration: Bhayo Prem Jouang Lage Nain Aise||
translation: The demons began to die and felt that they were considered worthy of love for Mohini.

gurmukhi: ਮਨੋ ਫਾਧ ਫਾਂਧੇ ਮ੍ਰਿਗੀ ਰਾਜ ਜੈਸੇ ॥੩॥
translation: They appeared like the lion entrapped in a snare.3.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਨੇ ਰਤਨ ਬਾਂਟੇ ਤੁਮੂੰ ਤਾਹਿ ਜਾਨੋ ॥
transliteration: Jine Ratan Baante Toumoond Taah(i) Jaano||
translation: You know the story of thee distribution of the jewels;

gurmukhi: ਕਥਾ ਬ੍ਰਿੱਧ ਤੇ ਬਾਤ ਥੋਰੀ ਬਖਾਨੋ ॥
translation: Therefore for fear of the increase in narration, I relate it only in brief;

gurmukhi: ਸਭੈ ਪਾਂਤ ਪਾਂਤੰ ਬਹਿੱਠੇ ਸੁ ਬੀਰੰ ॥ ਕਟੰ ਪੇਚ ਛੋਰੇ ਤਜੇ ਤੇਗ ਤੀਰੰ ॥੪॥
transliteration: Sabhai Paant Paantan Bahitthe Su Bderan|| Katan Pech Chhodhe Taje Teg Tderan||4||
translation: All the warriors, loosening the waist-garments and forsaking the sword, sat in a line.4.
